Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with lotus flower chain in added white outline with added red centres and white tendrils; exterior, slip worn: painted decoration consisting of probable sphinx (trace of hair and curlicue remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Sirens also have a curlicue at the top of their head but they are extremely rare in Chian painted pottery.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0424) (phase 2)
